document.title: Faith-Based Worldviews as a Challenge to the Believing Game
document.abstract: Elbow's "Believing Game" may help to make room in the academy for religious frames of mind, which encompass particularly dense networks of ideas and emotions.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Patricia Bizzell is Professor of English at the College of the Holy Cross, and a student in the Masters in Jewish Liberal Studies Program at Hebrew College. Among her publications are Academic Discourse and Critical Consciousness (1992) and The Rhetorical Tradition: Readings from Classical to Contemporary Times (2nd ed., 2001). Her recent scholarship has focused on the functions in religious persuasion of rationality and emotion, in work by nineteenth-century American women activists and by medieval and modern Jewish disputants.
